title: Australia bans social media for children under sixteen
snippets: In the hours before the cutoff, some children posted goodbye messages to their online audiences, using tags such as "#seeyouwhenim16."

The world is watching as Australia becomes the first country to ban under-16s from social media. Adults support it but children consider the ban an attack on their rights, which will isolate some of the most vulnerable.
The ban, a world-first, has been applauded by families looking to take back power from tech giants. But questions remain about its enforceability.
Children younger than 16 years old will be banned from using social media in Australia starting Wednesday.
Australia begins enforcing world-first teen social media ban Reuters
The measure, which affects anyone under 16, is one of the most sweeping efforts in the world to safeguard young people from the potential harms of the platforms.

Eyes around the world are turned to Australia as its world-first ban on social media for users under age 16 takes effect. The tough new law aims to block Australian children and younger teens from addictive platforms and harmful content online.
titles: Australia's social media ban for users under 16 takes effect
Australia social media ban: Children feel isolated, ignored
Social media ban for children under 16 starts in Australia
WATCH:  Australia bans social media for children under 16
Australia begins enforcing world-first teen social media ban - Reuters
Australia’s Social Media Ban for Children Takes Effect
Australia's social media ban for users under 16 starts now
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information about a new policy in Australia, which could impact readers' understanding of internet regulations and child protection measures. However, it doesn't highlight any progress or solutions to the problems it addresses.
summary: Australia has become the first country to ban social media use for anyone under 16, with the law taking effect on Wednesday. The measure aims to protect young people from online harms and has received support from many adults and families, though some children feel it restricts their rights. The ban's enforceability remains in question as global attention focuses on its impact.

summary: Nnena Kalu has won the 2025 Turner Prize for her colourful sculptures and drawings made from found fabric and materials. She is the first learning disabled artist to receive the award. The chair of the 2025 judging panel said her win helps to bridge the gap between neurotypical and neurodiverse artists.

title: Court gives Sudanese militia leader 20 years for war crimes
snippets: Judges at the International Criminal Court sentenced a leader of the Sudanese Janjaweed militia in Darfur to 20 years in prison. Muhammad Ali Abd Al-Rahman was convicted of war crimes and crimes against humanity.

Judges at the International Criminal Court sentenced a leader of the feared Sudanese Janjaweed militia to 20 years imprisonment Tuesday for war crimes and crimes against humanity committed in the catastrophic conflict in Darfur more than two decades ago.
titles: ICC sentences Sudan Janjaweed leader to 20 years in prison
ICC sentences Sudanese militia leader to 20 years in prison for Darfur atrocities
constructiveness_reason: This story reports on a significant event related to justice and accountability in Sudan. summary: On December 9, 2025, judges at the International Criminal Court sentenced Muhammad Ali Abd Al-Rahman, a leader of the Sudanese Janjaweed militia, to 20 years in prison for war crimes and crimes against humanity committed during the Darfur conflict over twenty years ago.

title: McMann suspended 1 game for actions in Maple Leafs game - NHL.com
snippets: McMann suspended 1 game for actions in Maple Leafs game NHL.com
McMann to have Player Safety hearing for actions in Maple Leafs game NHL.com

Toronto Maple Leafs forward Bobby McMann has been suspended for one game for high-sticking Tampa Bay Lightning forward Oliver Bjorkstrand, the NHL’s Department of Player Safety announced Tuesday. McMann had a hearing with Player Safety on Tuesday after receiving a match penalty for the play on Monday. McMann chopped down his stick on Bjorkstrand, striking him in the shoulder area during a third-period scrum that broke out following a knee-on-knee hit that left Maple Leafs defenceman Dakota Mermis injured. Lightning forward Gage Goncalves received a five-minute kneeing major and 10-minute game...
